content: add a little charm to your crochet collection with this adorable amigurumi tooth this pattern includes two variations a classic happy tooth and a playful sweet tooth topped with pink icing and a cherry designed to be simple yet full of personality this pattern uses basic crochet stitches and minimal sewing making it a fun project for both beginners and experienced crocheters alike not just a cute plushie this little tooth also doubles as a unique pin cushion the sweet tooth version even has colorful sprinkles made from sewing pins adding a fun and functional twist whether you re a crocheter a sewist or just love a good pun this amigurumi is sure to brighten your craft space perfect as a gift for dentists dental students or anyone with a sweet tooth this plushie is guaranteed to bring smiles skill level beginner-friendly techniques used single_crochet increases decreases basic embroidery ready to stitch up some smiles grab your hook and get started * i made this amigurumi using the yarn under single_crochet 1 technique this technique makes the stitches tighter and appears more aligned * use the ultimate finish 2 to close up the amigurumi crochet in continuous rounds do not join at the end of each round * use a running stitch marker 3 to keep your place when crocheting in rounds * **optional** i used the invisible increase and invisible decrease for a nicer finish * use different yarn weights/categories and the appropriate hook size for this project to make it bigger/smaller 1 https //www onceuponacheerio com/2022/05/how-to-yarn-under-single-crochet html 2 https //www onceuponacheerio com/2023/04/close-amigurumi-ultimate-finish html 3 https //www onceuponacheerio com/2023/04/how-to-use-running-stitch-marker html 4 https //www onceuponacheerio com/2019/07/half-colour-changes-for-perfect-stripes html
